congress.#text: One Hundred Thirteenth Congress of the United States of America

official-title.#text:
To amend the Harmful Algal Blooms and Hypoxia Research and Control Act of 1998, and for
			 other purposes.

role.#text: Speaker of the House of Representatives
Vice President of the United States and President of the Senate

header.#text: National harmful algal bloom and hypoxia program
National harmful algal bloom and hypoxia program

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Harmful Algal Bloom and Hypoxia Research and Control Amendments Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Harmful Algal Bloom and Hypoxia Research and Control Amendments Act of 2014

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, acting through the Task Force, shall maintain and enhance a national harmful
			 algal bloom and hypoxia program, including—

text.#text: Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of the

a statement of objectives, including understanding, detecting, predicting, controlling, mitigating,
			 and responding to marine and freshwater harmful algal bloom and hypoxia
			 events; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Harmful Algal Bloom and Hypoxia Research and Control Act of 1998/s:603B

text.#text: the comprehensive research plan and action strategy under
The Task Force shall periodically review and revise the Program, as necessary.
The Task Force shall—
coordinate interagency review of the objectives and activities of the Program;

expedite the interagency review process by ensuring timely review and dispersal of required reports
			 and assessments under this title;

support the implementation of the Action Strategy, including the coordination and integration of
			 the research of all Federal programs, including ocean and Great Lakes
			 science and management programs and centers, that address the chemical,
			 biological, and physical components of marine and freshwater harmful algal
			 blooms and hypoxia;

support the development of institutional mechanisms and financial instruments to further the
			 objectives and activities of the Program;

review the Program’s distribution of Federal funding to address the objectives and activities of
			 the Program;

promote the development of new technologies for predicting, monitoring, and mitigating harmful
			 algal bloom and hypoxia conditions; and
establish such interagency working groups as it considers necessary.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 have primary responsibility for administering the Program.

text.#text: Except as provided in subsection (h), the
In administering the Program, the
promote the Program;

prepare work and spending plans for implementing the research and activities identified under the
			 Action Strategy;
administer peer-reviewed, merit-based, competitive grant funding—
to maintain and enhance baseline monitoring programs established by the Program;
to support the projects maintained and established by the Program; and
to address the research and management needs and priorities identified in the Action Strategy;
coordinate with the

identify additional research, development, and demonstration needs and priorities relating to
			 monitoring, prevention, control, mitigation, and response to marine and
			 freshwater harmful algal blooms and hypoxia, including methods and
			 technologies to protect the ecosystems affected by marine and freshwater
			 harmful algal blooms and hypoxia;
support regional efforts to control and mitigate outbreaks through—

communication of the contents of the Action Strategy and maintenance of online data portals for
			 other information about harmful algal blooms and hypoxia to State, tribal,
			 and local stakeholders; and
overseeing the development, review, and periodic updating of the Action Strategy;
convene at least 1 meeting of the Task Force each year; and
perform such other tasks as may be delegated by the Task Force.
The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: relating to harmful algal blooms and hypoxia;

enhance communication and coordination among Federal agencies carrying out marine and freshwater

to the greatest extent practicable, leverage existing resources and expertise available from local

increase the availability to appropriate public and private entities of—
analytical facilities and technologies;
operational forecasts; and
reference and research materials.

shall work cooperatively and avoid duplication of effort with other offices,
			 centers, and programs within the

, other agencies on the Task Force, and States, tribes, and
			 nongovernmental organizations concerned with marine and freshwater issues
			 to coordinate harmful algal bloom and hypoxia (and related) activities and

under

text.#text:
With respect to the freshwater aspects of the Program, the Administrator, through the Task Force,
			 shall carry out the duties otherwise assigned to the
The Administrator's participation under this section shall include—
research on the ecology and impacts of freshwater harmful algal blooms; and

forecasting and monitoring of and event response to freshwater harmful algal blooms in lakes,
			 rivers, estuaries (including their tributaries), and reservoirs.

The Administrator shall ensure that activities carried out under this title focus on new approaches
			 to addressing freshwater harmful algal blooms and are not duplicative of
			 existing research and development programs authorized by this title or any
			 other law.

The collection of monitoring and observation data under this title shall comply with all data
			 standards and protocols developed pursuant to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
. Such data
			 shall be made available through the system established under that Act.

			 Ocean Observation System Act of 2009

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , is further amended by inserting after

text.#text: The Act, as amended by

header.#text: Comprehensive Research Plan and Action Strategy
Comprehensive Research Plan and Action Strategy

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Harmful Algal Bloom and Hypoxia Research and Control Amendments Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Harmful Algal Bloom and Hypoxia Research and Control Amendments Act of 2014

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, through the Task Force, shall develop and submit to Congress a comprehensive
			 research plan and action strategy to address marine and freshwater harmful
			 algal blooms and hypoxia. The Action Strategy shall identify—

text.#text: Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of the

the specific activities to be carried out by the Program and the timeline for carrying out those
			 activities;

the roles and responsibilities of each Federal agency in the Task Force in carrying out the
			 activities under paragraph (1); and

the appropriate regions and subregions requiring specific research and activities to address
			 harmful algal blooms and hypoxia.
The regional and subregional parts of the Action Strategy shall identify—

regional priorities for ecological, economic, and social research on issues related to the impacts
			 of harmful algal blooms and hypoxia;

research, development, and demonstration activities needed to develop and advance technologies and
			 techniques for minimizing the occurrence of harmful algal blooms and
			 hypoxia and improving capabilities to detect, predict, monitor, control,
			 mitigate, respond to, and remediate harmful algal blooms and hypoxia;

ways to reduce the duration and intensity of harmful algal blooms and hypoxia, including deployment
			 of response technologies in a timely manner;
research and methods to address human health dimensions of harmful algal blooms and hypoxia;

mechanisms by which data, information, and products may be transferred between the Program and the
			 State, tribal, and local governments and research entities;

communication and information dissemination methods that State, tribal, and local governments may
			 undertake to educate and inform the public concerning harmful algal blooms
			 and hypoxia; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Harmful Algal Bloom and Hypoxia Research and Control Act of 1998/s:603/ss:e

text.#text:
roles that Federal agencies may have to assist in the implementation of the Action Strategy,
			 including efforts to support local and regional scientific assessments
			 under

shall utilize existing research,
			 assessments, reports, and program activities, including—

text.#text: In developing the Action Strategy, the
those carried out under existing law; and
other relevant peer-reviewed and published sources.
In developing the Action Strategy, the
coordinate with—
State coastal management and planning officials;
tribal resource management officials; and

water management and watershed officials from both coastal States and noncoastal States with water
			 sources that drain into water bodies affected by harmful algal blooms and
			 hypoxia; and
consult with—
public health officials;
emergency management officials;
science and technology development institutions;
economists;
industries and businesses affected by marine and freshwater harmful algal blooms and hypoxia;

scientists with expertise concerning harmful algal blooms or hypoxia from academic or research
			 institutions; and
other stakeholders.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall publish the Action Strategy in the Federal Register.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, in coordination and consultation with the individuals and entities under
			 subsection (d), shall periodically review and revise the Action Strategy
			 prepared under this section, as necessary.

the activities carried out under the Program, including the regional and subregional parts of the
			 Action Strategy;
the budget related to the activities under paragraph (2);
the progress made on implementing the Action Strategy; and
any need to revise or terminate research and activities under the Program.

			 progress made by activities directed by the Mississippi River/Gulf of
			 Mexico Watershed Nutrient Task Force and carried out or funded by the

			 toward attainment of the goals of the Gulf Hypoxia Action Plan 2008.

text.#text: Beginning not later than 12 months after the date of enactment of the
Each report required under this section shall—
evaluate lessons learned; and

recommend appropriate actions to continue to implement or, if necessary, revise the strategy set
			 forth in the Gulf Hypoxia Action Plan 2008.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended to read as follows:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Harmful Algal Bloom and Hypoxia Research and Control Act of 1998/s:605

header.#text: Great Lakes hypoxia and harmful algal blooms
Great Lakes hypoxia and harmful algal blooms

short-title.#tail: , the Task Force, in accordance with the authority under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Harmful Algal Bloom and Hypoxia Research and Control Amendments Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Harmful Algal Bloom and Hypoxia Research and Control Amendments Act of 2014

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, shall complete and submit to
			 the Congress and the President an integrated assessment that examines the
			 causes, consequences, and approaches to reduce hypoxia and harmful algal
			 blooms in the Great Lakes, including the status of and gaps within current
			 research, monitoring, management, prevention, response, and control
			 activities by—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Harmful Algal Bloom and Hypoxia Research and Control Act of 1998/s:603

text.#text: Not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of the
Federal agencies;
State agencies;
regional research consortia;
academia;
private industry; and
nongovernmental organizations.

short-title.#tail: , the Task Force shall develop and submit to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Harmful Algal Bloom and Hypoxia Research and Control Amendments Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Harmful Algal Bloom and Hypoxia Research and Control Amendments Act of 2014

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
a plan, based on the integrated
			 assessment under subsection (a), for reducing, mitigating, and controlling
			 hypoxia and harmful algal blooms in the Great Lakes.

text.#text: Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of the
The plan shall—
address the monitoring needs identified in the integrated assessment under subsection (a);
develop a timeline and budgetary requirements for deployment of future assets;

identify requirements for the development and verification of Great Lakes hypoxia and harmful algal
			 bloom models, including—
all assumptions built into the models; and
data quality methods used to ensure the best available data are utilized; and
describe efforts to improve the assessment of the impacts of hypoxia and harmful algal blooms by—

characterizing current and past biological conditions in ecosystems affected by hypoxia and harmful
			 algal blooms; and
quantifying effects, including economic effects, at the population and community levels.
In developing the plan, the Task Force shall—
coordinate with State and local governments;

consult with representatives from academic, agricultural, industry, and other stakeholder groups,
			 including relevant Canadian agencies;

ensure that the plan complements and does not duplicate activities conducted by other Federal or
			 State agencies;

identify critical research for reducing, mitigating, and controlling hypoxia events and their
			 effects;
evaluate cost-effective, incentive-based partnership approaches;
ensure that the plan is technically sound and cost effective;
utilize existing research, assessments, reports, and program activities;

publish a summary of the proposed plan in the Federal Register at least 180 days prior to
			 submitting the completed plan to Congress; and

after submitting the completed plan to Congress, provide biennial progress reports on the
			 activities toward achieving the objectives of the plan.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Harmful Algal Bloom and Hypoxia Research and Control Act of 1998/s:606

text.#text: The Act is amended by adding after

Nothing in this title supersedes or limits the authority of any agency to carry out its
			 responsibilities and missions under other laws.
Nothing in this title may be construed as establishing new regulatory authority for any agency.

term.#tail:
means marine and freshwater phytoplankton that proliferate to high concentrations, resulting in
			 nuisance conditions or harmful impacts on marine and aquatic ecosystems,
			 coastal communities, and human health through the production of toxic
			 compounds or other biological, chemical, and physical impacts of the algae
			 outbreak.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail:
means a condition where low dissolved oxygen in aquatic systems causes stress or death to resident
			 organisms.
